column1: full and straight, hint of swing, clipped neatly wide of mid-on
full outside off, 132kph, a big swing and a miss as he aim a huge drive through the off side
gets on the pads, flicked away very fine wide of the diving keeper
back at off stump, full, strongly driven to mid-off
wide outside, doesn't get much timing into this drive and it rolls to mid-off
full and straight, clipped out to deep square leg
he nails this drive! Superbly fielded at cover as Swepson dives to his right. That was flying
caught down the leg side! Salt's struggles continue. A poor ball, outside the pads, Salt goes to flick it away and gets a thin edge which is well held
hammered! Full outside off, that's a statement from Head, gets onto the front foot and slots it between cover and mid-off
pulls the length back, short on leg stump, takes the thigh pad down the leg side
back of a length outside, threads the gap through cover, playing off the back foot with a square drive

taken, but almost a nasty collision! That was short and sharp, banged in on leg stump, Head gets into a tangle and it flies off the top edge around the corner as he tries to turn it away. Peirson and Mujeeb bump into each other, but the keeper holds on
full and straight, clipped to midwicket
on the pads, worked through square leg
round the wicket, short of a length, forced into the leg side
through him! A touch quicker, this slides on, takes the inside edge and scoots past leg stump
worked off the pads into square leg
short outside off, steps back and cuts to point. Tidy start of Mujeeb
short of a length, straight, 140kph, does him for pace and he gets an inside edge to the leg side
short of a length at off stump, pulled through midwicket
back of a length at off stump, opens the face to short third man
Weatherald has to get the dive out! A length ball clipped off the pads to short fine leg
edged, caught behind! Pattinson is having a day to remember. Not a great shot, really, given the situation. Full outside off, zips through, Weatherald plays a big drive on the up and nicks it
good length outside off, 141kph, nice line and left alone
full on the pads, worked to deep square leg
round the wicket, short of a length, slides on to the left hander and is played to point
gets his line wrong, pushed in at the pads, flicked very fine past the keeper
dropped at slip! A very tough chance for Lynn as the top edge flew from a cut shot
full outside off, driven to mid-off for a tight(ish) single
driven to cover
lovely shot, full outside off, opens the face and places it behind point. Excellent timing
another caught down the leg side! Would you believe it...short of a length on leg stump, looks to flick it away, and it's another edge to Peirson
what a shot! Full at off stump, drilled straight down the ground with the perfect on drive. Not a bad way to get off the mark
a shorter delivery, swivels on the pull and sends it backward of square...perfect placement. Fair to say it's happening
short of a length outside off, pulled in front of square
cracked square! Good length outside off, driven through point with power and placement
full and straight, flicked down the ground to long-on
beats the edge! Lovely delivery. Starts outside off and goes on with the arm
dragged down short, pulled in the air over midwicket
flicked off the toes to midwicket
steps back to leg and square drives a short-of-a-length delivery to deep point
tucked off the stumps backward of square
over the wicket, good length angle across, beats the edge of a big drive
short of a length stump, rebounds into backward point and a direct hit might have been close
back of a length on off stump, played with an open face to point
on middle and leg, tucked off the hip into square leg

taken on the juggle, what a catch! Lalor grabs on at third attempt. A full delivery, bunted back down the pitch, to the right of Lalor who parries it before finally hanging on. Did brilliantly well to keep his composure
edged, short of slip! Back of a length on middle and off, takes a thick outside edge but goes to ground
good length at off stump, steps back and cuts to deep point
full at the stumps, driven to long-off
uses his feet, it's quite a short delivery, tapped to the on side
steps back again and cuts, takes the bottom edge into the pitch and bobbles to the off side
full on middle, nice length, defended
the googly, steps back and square cuts through point...not the best bit of fielding. A bonus for the Strikers
short of a length at off stump, 136kph, defended towards cover
fuller, angling into the pads, Pattinson appeals for lbw but no one else is interested and comfortably missing leg
short of a length, 141kph, pushed down the leg side
full at off stump, driven nicely to mid-off
back of a length, straight, nudged to the leg side
caught at cover, five for Pattinson! Full outside off, he comes forward to drive, can't keep it down and it's a very good low catch from de Villiers. A career-best for Pattinson in T20s
full outside off, driven to point...the end of a great day for Pattinson
good length leg break, he pushes this to wide mid on
short drag down, he's back and smacking a pull shot powerfully in the gap at wide long on
short and wide, he's back and cutting hard to deep point
good length leg break, he defends with soft hands to short third man
flatter on middle, he's back and across, knocking it to midwicket
pushed through on leg, it takes him on the thigh guard as he tries to whip
beaten by a back of a length, 120kph ball that swung away sharply
beaten again by a fuller ball that shapes away and he drives and misses
130kph, short ball, he swats it baseball style to deep midwicket on the bounce
shorter outside off, 118kph slower ball, he mistimes a cut to cover
130kph, good length outswinger, he jabs at it and edges fine of third man for a couple
114kph, slower ball on off, he defends from the crease to point

Is he stumped? Beautifully bowled. Tossed up outside off, he plays for the off spin and it spins the other way as he drives. His foot dragged out, he just placed his toe back on the line as Peirson takes the bails off. This is really tight. His toe is down but is there something behind the line? The third umpire has a long look. Not out is the call. Benefit of the doubt to Rashid. That's the right call
shorter off break, he's back and tucking this to midwicket
quicker ball, 97kph, he's back and defending to point
off break, he is forward and defending
full yorker, jammed into off and he digs it out
short ball, he tries to pull, it comes off thigh pad and bounces up, Peirson dives from behind the stumps and takes it but there was no bat involved
clears the front leg and slices this high over mid off, doesn't nail it and de Villiers chases it down
short ball, he plays a tennis smash back to the bowler
115kph, shorter slower ball, he's back and tucking this to forward square
122kph, length ball, he pushes this to point and they take a tight single as Lalor shies
114kph, slower ball, he tries to work to leg but gets a leading edge
slower ball, he is back and clipping this forward of square
tossed up outside off, he dances down and stays leg side to thump this up and over cover! That is from the top drawer. Super shot
tossed up outside off, he pushes back to the bowler
missed caught and bowled chance. He skips down and hits this flat back at Swepson and he missed it with the one hand

Stumped comprehensively! Lovely bowling. Neser jumped down early, Swepson delivers a slower leg break, 75kph, it drops and spins sharply past the edge, Neser is done all ends up and Peirson completes the easy stumping
86kph, tossed up outside off, he pushes on the front foot to cover
looping leg break, 71kph, he reaches out to defend
113kph, length ball on off, he's back and working this to midwicket and calls two immediately and gets it
shorter length, he's back and tucking this off the inside edge onto thigh pad and it rolls away
shorter slower ball, he's back and running this to third man
Rashid walks down early, Cutting delivers a short ball, he tries to upper cut but misses
launched into the second tier at long on! Wow! He charged down to a length ball and clubbed it on the up!
beaten trying to run a length ball, 131kph, down to third man
shorter length, he's back and cutting forward of point for a couple
slower leg break, he's back and late cutting to short third man
wrong un, he slog sweeps, doesn't flush it but finds the gap at deep midwicket
tossed up outside off, he square drives to point
shorter length, he defends off the back foot
looped up leg break, it spins sharply, he closes the face and gets a leading edge that runs to short third man
113kph, short ball, he walks down, it's pushed wide, he mistimes a cut
he charges at a short ball and pulls on the move, straight of deep midwicket for a couple
charges again at a short ball, tries to cut past short third man but misses. He's furious he missed it
he's hit in the helmet trying to reverse sweep a short ball! It came off shoulder first so that softened the blow. He's OK. Ambitious shot

caught at deep midwicket! He walks down at a 112kph, slower ball, he lofts this high into the leg side but gets under it and it falls short of the rope. Renshaw waits under it and takes the catch well.
short into the hip, he chips a pull shot behind square that lands safely
113kph, slower ball on off, he steps inside it and flicks past short fine! Good shot
yorker into middle, he dugs this out to midwicket, Cutting sprints across, they think about two but wisely don't go
short slower ball, he's back and defending into the off side

Caught and bowled! Well bowled. Short slower ball where he rolled the fingers down it, he backed away trying to pull and then checked his shot only to bunt it straight back to the bowler. Easy catch for Cutting
115kph, short slower ball, he ducks first and then tries to pull

chipped to mid off! The Strikers are bowled out for 110. This was fuller ball outside off, he cleared the front leg and tried to loft his over mid off, he miscued and lobbed at easy catch to de Villiers on the circle
inside edge past the stumps! Back of a length, he goes for a square cut and gets an under edge...when it's your day
back of a length on the pads, worked through midwicket
taken at mid-on! Terrific catch. A length ball, Lynn doesn't hold back, strikes through the line and sends it low to mid-on. He generally only plays one way...
short outside off, goes for a square cut and gets a bottom edge into the ground back towards the keeper...interesting start by the Heat
inside the line of a short-of-a-length delivery and tucks out to midwicket
full at the stumps, a meaty swing across the line sends it to deep midwicket
just wide of midwicket! Hacks across the line of a full delivery on off stumo
through him! What are they doing? A googly, spins back nicely, Bryant misses his drive and there's a huge gap. Pretty awful batting if we are honest
what a start! Full outside off, he strides forward and slots away the perfect cover drive
comes forward and pushes this one to the off side
a shorter delivery, slides on, worked off the pads into square leg
good length at off stump, defended. Game on
length ball outside off, angled down to third man
well bowled, length ball angled across outside off, beats the outside edge as he plays away from the body
what shot! Man at the other end would be pleased with that. Full at off stump, a simple strike through the line sends it fractionally over the rope at long-on
good length at off stump, worked into midwicket
did he edge that? Didn't carry to the keeper. A slower ball, Renshaw drives, might have been a thin one on that
just over mid-off! Full outside off, he drives on the up and just has the elevation to evade Siddle
very full, dug out towards long-on
full at leg stump, tucked off the pads to midwicket
touch shorter, worked through the on side
terrific shot, full at the stumps, de Villiers gives himself a touch of room and drives it along the ground through the covers. Rashid bowled that from behind the stumps
pulls the length ball, cuts to point
now he goes over cover...dragged down short, de Villiers rocks back and doesn't try to keep this one down, goes up and over the off side
dropped by Siddle and he's hurt himself! Full on off stump, drilled back down the pitch, Siddle got his right finger tips on it
full at middle and leg, gets a leading edge into the off side
full outside off, nice stride forward and a solid drive to mid-off
very full at off stump, drives with an open face and finds backward point
and again, another full one to drive, sends it to the right of mid-off
back of a length at off stump, 137kph, runs it down to third man
pumped away! Great sound off the bat. Just short of a length, de Villiers pulls off the front foot well in front of square
uses his feet, doesn't get close to the pitch, pushes towards mid-on
lovely batting, a classical cover drive as he comes forward and places a half volley through the off side
round the wicket, short of a length into the hip, turned to short fine leg and AB sprints through
good length at the stumps, a slower ball at 116kph, pushed down the ground
over the off side! That's a wonderful shot, another good stride into the ball and sends this over the covers. Anything AB can do...
full at off stump, flicked into midwicket
drives a very full delivery to mid-off
chips a length ball into midwicket and that's brilliant running to make a second
a shorter ball takes the pad as de Villiers misses the flick
works a short-of-a-length delivery into midwicket
pushed across outside off, left alone
a low full toss which de Villiers puts away with a drive through the covers. That's a freebie
dragged down short outside off this time, flat-batted towards long-off
aims to work into the on side, leading edge to cover, then there's a single as the under-arm throw rebounds off the stumps
dabbed away to short third man
full on the toes, clipped to deep square leg
worked into the leg side
back of a length outside off, angled down to third man
back of a length, straight, worked into midwicket
full outside off, driven firmly into the ground then to cover
a short ball over leg stump, allows it to go through
short of a length, shoveled into midwicket with the bottom hand
full and straight, pushed to mid-on
short of a length, tucked into the leg side
a short ball outside off, he considers a ramp but leaves it alone
excellent yorker at leg stump, de Villiers has to be quick to dig out that
uses his feet, takes the toe end towards mid-off...and it's a no-ball!
well bowled, gets the yorker in, drilled down the ground and good running
back of a length, dabbed into backward point
well bowled! Back of a length at middle, de Villiers giving himself a hint of room and this zips past the outside edge
cut into backward point
tapped into midwicket, another example of how he perfectly weights the shot. So delicate
clipped off the toes into square leg
short of a length, spins down the leg side
short on the pads, whipped backward of square
full and driven back to the bowler
defends a length ball, a googly, and the ball trickles to the leg side
round the wicket, short outside off, defended down into the pitch
short again, opens the face and runs it into backward point
a slower short ball, pulled through square leg, sprints back for the second...such control in the shot. They are sending it to the third umpire but he's well home
he moves to leg, it's short outside off, he lets it go through
lovely stuff, a short ball on off stump, he ramps it over the keeper but third man can get across
round the wicket, moves outside leg, gets an inside edge into the pads
picks out long-on! Well, mark that down on things you didn't expect to see. Dropped down short, de Villiers rocks back and pulls it straight to the fielder
short again, driven off the back foot to deep cover
gets down early and plays a deft paddle-sweep to a full delivery on the stumps, nicely done
and he does it again, the delivery isn't as full this time, paddles it through fine leg
full at off stump, driven firmly to cover who parries it away
goes back and works a short delivery to long-on
back of a length, worked off the pads into midwicket
a short ball, he ducks
back of a length, forced off the back foot to mid-off
fuller, at the stumps, played back to the bowler
short of a length, pulled firmly in front of square...and there's an overthrow which sums things up for the Strikers
moves outside leg and drives nicely into the gap at cover
leans forward and defends
shorter outside off, chopped into the pitch and it runs square
short on the pads, worked to deep square
full and straight, worked down the ground to long-on
clips a full delivery to deep midwicket
short outside off, cut to the cover sweeper. It's nearly done
angled into the pads, worked to long leg
top edge over the keeper! Swings hard at a short ball and it takes him to his fifty
